forumNotes.author: Wonko the Sane
forumNotes.content:
So, first part of booting is OK, meaning that you get to grub4dos choices in menu.lst, right? If yes, you may want to read again this: (same as **shamurshamur** suggested) Then start with a method. The suggested one is: * list the whatever .iso's you want to boot * choose one, and just one out of the list * check if that particular item is ALREADY listed here: * SEARCH the grub4dos forum checking if that particular item has already been talked about * IF yes, AND where it is talked there is NOT a solution (or the solution as is doesn't work for you), THEN post a single, specific request there * IF no, start A NEW, single, specific thread in the appropriate Forum: * tackle next one in the list
BEFORE that, READ the grub4dos guide: [http://diddy.boot-la...os/Grub4dos.htm](http://diddy.boot-land.net/grub4dos/Grub4dos.htm "External link") particularly: [http://diddy.boot-la...iles/basics.htm](http://diddy.boot-land.net/grub4dos/files/basics.htm "External link") [http://diddy.boot-la...s/files/cli.htm](http://diddy.boot-land.net/grub4dos/files/cli.htm "External link") When experimenting ALWAYS use Command Line and NEVER a pre-made menu.lst entry (i.e. try using the contents of a menu.lst entry that you find by typing it manually and checking at each line the feedback grub4dos gives you). OT, but not much. This is a problem ![:mellow:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/mellow.png): > Manually doing it by myself is going to be a hang it up type situation. Not going to happen. everyone here will try to help you, and a *limited* amount of spoon-feeding assistance is usually given to new members, but do not expect that anyone will do your homeworks. Particularly as a computer forensics student you show - no offence intended :smile: - a preoccupying lack of "drive" ![:w00t:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/w00t.gif). Again, no offence intended whatsoever, but you appear like having a very common misconception, which may be a problem if you really want to continue in this branch, the idea that "more" tools available make a "better" expert. Lots of people think that it's all about having tools and using them, whilst it's all about knowledge, something that you can only get with hard work and an inquisitive mind. Back to topic. The fact that the stick you are using is an U3 (and has a CD-like device additional to the normal HD-like) may be part of the problem, it is possible that you will need to change something in the menu.lst entries that you find. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) Wonko

So what is the problem? Most of the others iso's will boot also
you say. The RMprepUSB website has a grub4dos tutorial and the last section has a long list of menu.lst examples. Also there is the grub4dos forum here. If you have some specific boot iso's which don't work, you need to:  

1. Say which ones don't work (not which ones do work!)  
2. Give us the menu.lst you are using  
3. Tell us what error messages you see for each one and what diagnostics you have done  
4. Try it in an emulator AND a real system (preferably several real systems) and let us know what happens in each case.  

Please do not use phrases like 'it doesn't work' or 'with no luck'.  

Compare these 2 questions?  

1. My car doesn't work - how do I fix it?  
2. My car will not start. When I put the ignition key in, the starter motor makes the usual noise and I can hear the engine turning but the engine does not seem to 'catch' and it just keeps turning for as long as I hold the key in and never starts. The needle on the fuel gauge is pointing to the 'E' symbol. How do I fix it?
